H0.text: method used by a writer to develop a character. Characterization

H1.text: method used by a writer to develop a character. Foil

H2.text: method used by a writer to develop a character. Symbolism

H3.text: method used by a writer to develop a character. Hamartia

A4.text: Characterization or characterisation is the representation of characters (persons, creatures, or other beings) in narrative and dramatic works.

A5.text: The use of mythology is used in Shakespeare's Hamlet as a device to parallel the characters and to reflect back on them  their role in the story, such as the use of the Niobe myth and the twin sister of Gertrude.

A6.text: Character and characterisation in The UVic Writer's Guide (from the University of Victoria)
